Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which contact-tracing apps have access to contact lists and Facebook accounts.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that these apps can only track the locations of voluntary app users and not the locations of people in their contacts list who have not installed the app.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that contact-tracing apps are tracking phone contacts and Facebook friends lists.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that contact-tracing apps have access to personal information without providing sufficient evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that contact-tracing apps are designed to track locations for public health purposes and not for tracking phone contacts or Facebook friends.
